etymology.description: Depicts a feather or a strand of hair
etymology.interpretation: The character 毛(máo, 'hair') visually represents a feather or hair, conveying the concept of something that is thin and soft.

examples.chinese: 猫的毛很柔软(貓的毛很柔軟)。
examples.english: The cat's hair is very soft.

examples.chinese: 他早上醒来时(他早上醒來時)，发现额前飘落一缕毛(發現額前飄落一縷毛)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǎoshang xǐng lái shí, fāxiàn é qián piāoluò yī lǚ máo.
examples.english: When he woke up in the morning, he found a strand of hair floating on his forehead.

examples.chinese: 他家小狗的毛非常蓬松(他家小狗的毛非常蓬鬆)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiā xiǎogǒu de máo fēicháng péngsōng.
examples.english: His puppy's hair is very fluffy.
